results.title: Thailand: a land of smiles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”
Presents traditional aspects of the culture of Thailand. Discusses the geography, emphasising the importance of water for travel and agriculture. Shows dances, festivals, handicrafts, and the influence of religion on Thailand’s culture.

results.title: Balance 1950
results.brief_description: Animated drawings showing the balance sheet of Imperial Chemical Industries for 1950. Vivacious little “match stick” men, aided by ever active “Pound” and other devices perform against a backdrop of graphs and ledgers. An interesting example of simplified animation technique in which an unpopular subject is treated in an entertaining way.

results.title: Bakhtiari migration. [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Anthony Howarth, David Koff and Anthony-David Productions
results.brief_description: An excellent record of one of the most hazardous feats of human endurance still undertaken. Shows the way in which half a million people together with millions of valuable sheep, goats, mules, and dogs struggle for five weeks to make the two hundred mile crossing of the Zagros mountains in southern Iran.

results.title: Baked bean story
results.brief_description: This film shows the various steps involved in the production of the famous British “delicacy” of baked beans from their beginnings on an Ontario farm to the time when they are devoured as part of a typical English meal. A useful example of vertically integrated food processing and the importance of quality control in manufacturing. Suitable for Upper Primary-Lower Secondary students. No other credits available.

results.title: Badminton: gripping, footwork, serving
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the principles of correct badminton technique. Shows backhand and forehand grips; placement od feet when serving and playing; and the different types of serves - low short forehand, low short backhand, flick serve and drive serve.

results.title: Backthenrightnowlateron
results.creator_credit: Luke Monsour, David Megarrity and Queensland Performing Arts Centre
results.brief_description:
Mixing interviews, images and tiny fictions, “Backthenrightnowlateron” is a funny and moving collection of children’s thoughts on their past, present and future.
The work is divided into three segments - Backthen, Rightnow, Lateron. Each segment features children from Class 2J, Yeronga State School, with their favourite toy sharing their thoughts with interviewer Georgia Seffrin, and a mini-film starring one of the toys - Chicky goes to nana’s house, Red Ted goes to England, Minotaur goes to war. Provides a wonderful and amusing insight into young children’s minds.
Developed from an original concept and commission by QPAC’s “Out of the Box” Festival of Early Childhood for the OOTB Symposium, September 2003.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Luke Monsour, David Megarrity and Queensland Performing Arts Centre

results.title: Backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly, freestyle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Swimming with Mark Tonelli”.
A compilation tape containing five programmes designed to instruct on swimming techniques. 1.Backstroke. Demonstrated by Commonwealth Gold Medallist Mark Tonelli. 2.Breaststroke. Demonstrated by British Gold Medallist Duncan Tonelli. 3.Butterfly. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli. 4. Freestyle. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli. 5.Starts and Turns. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli and Drew Mayhew.

results.title: Swimming
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Swimming with Mark Tonelli”.
Approved by the Department of Education, this video is designed for swimming instruction. Mark Tonelli and Duncan Goodhew, both Olympic gold medallists, give instruction on freestyle, breaststroke, backstroke, butterfly and the mechanics of swimming. Each stroke is treated as a separate entity. Teacher’s notes are also available.
